intro: Elatostema coriaceifolium var. coriaceifolium, commonly known as the hard-leaved elatostema, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is characterized by its thick, waxy leaves that are typically ovate to elliptic in shape. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are usually greenish or yellowish in color. It is native to regions of Southeast Asia, including parts of China and Indonesia. This species is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
